result.execSummary:
The defendant Raimundo A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA and Victim/Witness surcharges during period of probation.  Provide DNA sample and pay costs.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED and the balance to be paid by 1-23-15 or a civil judgment to be entered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raimundo A Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant called to correct his address.
jad

ADDRESS INFO for Raimundo A Jones
Current: 525 S. Memorial Ave., Rockford, IL 61102 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2014)
Prior: 5225 Memorial Ave, Rockford, IL 61102 United States

Defendant Raimundo A Jones in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BR. 10.
Defendant is currently registered in Illinois, butmust supply his address to WI Department of Corrections.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by counsels and defendant.
The Court orders the defendant to serve 16 days in the House of Correction with credit for 16 days-TIME SERVED.
The Court orders the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA and Victim/Witness surcharges during period of probation.  Provide DNA sample and pay costs.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED  and the balance to be paid by 1-23-2015 or a civil judgment to be entered.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
 Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Court in trial.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders other conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $100 CASH.

Defendant Raimundo A Jones in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Raimundo A Jones in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Raimundo A Jones in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Raimundo A Jones in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
